content: or 18 20 22 or desired length note if knitting long-ish i-cords doesn t appeal you could use a knitting mill or french knitter to make your cords make twisted cords or use some bias binding instead if you choose to knit with a yarn which has little or no stretch then you may need to add some length to your i-cords to compensate likewise if you choose to use bias binding you may need to make your ties longer making up and finishing weave in ends on both i-cords join sole seam then close the back seam taking care not to lose any eyelets weave in all remaining ends note i use whip stitch for the sole and an invisible method to join the garter stitch at the back seam you may prefer to use an invisible method for the sole too beginning at the centre front thread your ties through the eyelets of your bootees note a safety pin may help make this easier you should have an even number of eyelets so that they work 4 copyright ©2010 2015 maryjane thompson useful links long tail cast
